blocks.name: cuz
blocks.content: Extend class notation with the upper integer function. Read " ` ZZ>= `` M ` " as "the set of integers greater than or equal to ` M ` ".
blocks.origin: const class cuz { ℤ≥ }

blocks.name: diff.cuz.s
diff.cuz.c
diff.cuz.w
df-uz
blocks.content: Define a function whose value at ` j ` is the semi-infinite set of contiguous integers starting at ` j ` , which we will also call the upper integers starting at ` j ` . Read " ` ZZ>= `` M ` " as "the set of integers greater than or equal to ` M ` ". See ~ uzval for its value, ~ uzssz for its relationship to ` ZZ ` , ~ nnuz and ~ nn0uz for its relationships to ` NN ` and ` NN0 ` , and ~ eluz1 and ~ eluz2 for its membership relations. (Contributed by NM, 5-Sep-2005.)

blocks.name: uzval
blocks.content: The value of the upper integers function. (Contributed by NM, 5-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 3-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm uzval(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cz), wceq(cfv(cuz, c0), crab(s0, cz, wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, cz, cuz, crab(s0, cz, wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0))), crab(s0, cz, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(s0))))
  rabbidv(s0, cz, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(s0)), wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)))
  breq1(cv(hs0), c0, cle, cv(s0))
  df-uz(hs0, s0)
  rabex(s0, cz, wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)))
  zex()
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(crab(s0, cz, wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cz.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm uzval(setvar s0, class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℤ →(ℤ≥ ` c0)= { s0 ∈ ℤ | c0[≤]s0 })
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, cz, cuz, { s0 ∈ ℤ | c0[≤]s0 }, { s0 ∈ ℤ | hs0[≤]s0 })
  rabbidv(s0, cz, hs0 = c0, hs0[≤]s0, c0[≤]s0)
  breq1(hs0, c0, cle, s0)
  df-uz(hs0, s0)
  rabex(s0, cz, c0[≤]s0)
  zex()
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c({ s0 ∈ ℤ | c0[≤]s0 })
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cz.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: uzf
blocks.content: The domain and range of the upper integers function. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 8-Aug-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 3-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm uzf() {
  |- wf(cuz, cz, cpw(cz))
} = {
  mpbi(wf(cuz, cz, cpw(cz)), wral(hs0, cz, wcel(crab(hs1, cz, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(hs1))), cpw(cz))))
  rgenw(hs0, cz, wcel(crab(hs1, cz, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(hs1))), cpw(cz)))
  elpwi2(crab(hs1, cz, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(hs1))), cz, universe)
  zex()
  ssrab2(hs1, cz, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(hs1)))
  fmpt(hs0, cz, crab(hs1, cz, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(hs1))), cpw(cz), cuz)
  df-uz(hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(cz))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm uzf() {
  ⊢ (ℤ≥ : ℤ → P(ℤ))
} = {
  mpbi((ℤ≥ : ℤ → P(ℤ)), ∀(hs0 ∈ ℤ, { hs1 ∈ ℤ | hs0[≤]hs1 } ∈ P(ℤ)))
  rgenw(hs0, cz, { hs1 ∈ ℤ | hs0[≤]hs1 } ∈ P(ℤ))
  elpwi2({ hs1 ∈ ℤ | hs0[≤]hs1 }, cz, universe)
  zex()
  ssrab2(hs1, cz, hs0[≤]hs1)
  fmpt(hs0, cz, { hs1 ∈ ℤ | hs0[≤]hs1 }, P(ℤ), cuz)
  df-uz(hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(P(ℤ))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
}

blocks.name: eluz2
blocks.content: Membership in an upper set of integers. We use the fact that a function's value (under our function value definition) is empty outside of its domain to show ` M e. ZZ ` . (Contributed by NM, 5-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 3-Nov-2013.)

blocks.name: eluzmn
blocks.content: Membership in an earlier upper set of integers. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 8-Oct-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm eluzmn(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0)), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, co(c0, cmin, c1))))
} = {
  syl3anbrc(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0)), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, co(c0, cmin, c1))), wcel(co(c0, cmin, c1), cz), wcel(c0, cz), wbr(co(c0, cmin, c1), cle, c0))
  zsubcld(c0, c1, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0)))
  nn0zd(c1, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0)))
  breqtrd(co(c0, cmin, c1), cle, c0, co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmin, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0)))
  lesub1dd(c0, c1, co(c0, caddc, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0)))
  readdcld(c0, c1, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0)))
  sylancom(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, co(c0, caddc, c1)), wcel(c0, cr))
  nn0addge1(c0, c1)
  pncand(c0, c1, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0)))
  recnd(c0, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0)))
  zred(c0, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0)))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0))
  recnd(c1, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0)))
  nn0red(c1, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0)))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn0))
  eluz2(c0, co(c0, cmin, c1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm eluzmn(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0)→ c0 ∈(ℤ≥ `(c0[-]c1)))
} = {
  syl3anbrc((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0), c0 ∈(ℤ≥ `(c0[-]c1)), (c0[-]c1)∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ ℤ, (c0[-]c1)[≤]c0)
  zsubcld(c0, c1, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0))
  nn0zd(c1, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0))
  breqtrd((c0[-]c1), cle, c0, ((c0[+]c1)[-]c1), (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0))
  lesub1dd(c0, c1, (c0[+]c1), (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0))
  readdcld(c0, c1, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0))
  sylancom(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℕ0, c0[≤](c0[+]c1), c0 ∈ ℝ)
  nn0addge1(c0, c1)
  pncand(c0, c1, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0))
  recnd(c0, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0))
  zred(c0, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0))
  simpl(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℕ0)
  recnd(c1, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0))
  nn0red(c1, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0))
  simpr(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℕ0)
  eluz2(c0, (c0[-]c1))
}

blocks.name: eluz1i
blocks.content: Membership in an upper set of integers. (Contributed by NM, 5-Sep-2005.)

blocks.name: eluzuzle
blocks.content: An integer in an upper set of integers is an element of an upper set of integers with a smaller bound. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-Jun-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm eluzuzle(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wi(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0))))
} = {
  syl5bi(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c2)))
  eluz2(c2, c1)
  ex(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c2)), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)))
  syl3anbrc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c2))), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, c0)), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c2))
  simpll(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c1), w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c2)))
  simpr2(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c2))
  letrd(c0, c2, c1, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c2))))
  ad2antrr(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c1), w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c2)), wcel(c0, cr))
  zre(c0)
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c2)), wcel(c1, cr))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c2), wcel(c1, cr))
  zre(c1)
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c2)), wcel(c2, cr))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c2), wcel(c2, cr))
  zre(c2)
  simplr(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c1), w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c2)))
  simpr3(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(c1, cle, c2))
  eluz2(c2, c0)
}

blocks.name: uzn0
blocks.content: The upper integers are all nonempty. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Jan-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm uzn0(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, crn(cuz)), wne(c0, emptycls))
} = {
  sylbi(wcel(c0, crn(cuz)), wne(c0, emptycls), wrex(hs0, cz, wceq(cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), c0)))
  mp2b(wb(wcel(c0, crn(cuz)), wrex(hs0, cz, wceq(cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), c0))), wf(cuz, cz, cpw(cz)), wfn(cuz, cz))
  uzf()
  ffn(cuz, cz, cpw(cz))
  fvelrnb(hs0, cuz, cz, c0)
  rexlimiv(hs0, cz, wceq(cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), c0), wne(c0, emptycls))
  syl5ibcom(wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wceq(cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), c0), wne(c0, emptycls), wne(cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), emptycls))
  ne0d(cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs0), cz))
  uzid(cv(hs0))
  neeq1(cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), c0, emptycls)
  diff.hs0.c(cuz)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wne(c0, emptycls))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm uzn0(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ran(ℤ≥)→ c0 ≠ ∅)
} = {
  sylbi(c0 ∈ ran(ℤ≥), c0 ≠ ∅, ∃(hs0 ∈ ℤ,(ℤ≥ ` hs0)= c0))
  mp2b((c0 ∈ ran(ℤ≥)↔ ∃(hs0 ∈ ℤ,(ℤ≥ ` hs0)= c0)), (ℤ≥ : ℤ → P(ℤ)), ℤ≥[Fn]ℤ)
  uzf()
  ffn(cuz, cz, P(ℤ))
  fvelrnb(hs0, cuz, cz, c0)
  rexlimiv(hs0, cz, (ℤ≥ ` hs0)= c0, c0 ≠ ∅)
  syl5ibcom(hs0 ∈ ℤ, (ℤ≥ ` hs0)= c0, c0 ≠ ∅, (ℤ≥ ` hs0)≠ ∅)
  ne0d((ℤ≥ ` hs0), hs0, hs0 ∈ ℤ)
  uzid(hs0)
  neeq1((ℤ≥ ` hs0), c0, emptycls)
  diff.hs0.c(cuz)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ≠ ∅)
}

blocks.name: uztrn
blocks.content: Transitive law for sets of upper integers. (Contributed by NM, 20-Sep-2005.)
blocks.origin:
thm uztrn(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c2))), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c2)))
} = {
  syl3anbrc(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c2))), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c2)), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c2, cle, c0))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c2)), wcel(c2, cz))
  mp2and(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c2))), wbr(c2, cle, c0), wbr(c2, cle, c1), wbr(c1, cle, c0))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c2)), wbr(c2, cle, c1))
  eluzle(c1, c2)
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c2)), wbr(c1, cle, c0))
  eluzle(c0, c1)
  syl2an23an(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c2)), wi(wa(wbr(c2, cle, c1), wbr(c1, cle, c0)), wbr(c2, cle, c0)), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz))
  eluzel2(c1, c2)
  eluzelz(c1, c2)
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c2)), wcel(c0, cz))
  eluzelz(c0, c1)
  zletr(c2, c1, c0)
  eluz2(c0, c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm uztrn(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)∧ c1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c2))→ c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c2))
} = {
  syl3anbrc((c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)∧ c1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c2)), c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c2), c2 ∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ ℤ, c2[≤]c0)
  adantl(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), c1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c2), c2 ∈ ℤ)
  mp2and((c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)∧ c1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c2)), c2[≤]c0, c2[≤]c1, c1[≤]c0)
  adantl(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), c1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c2), c2[≤]c1)
  eluzle(c1, c2)
  adantr(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), c1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c2), c1[≤]c0)
  eluzle(c0, c1)
  syl2an23an(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), c1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c2), ((c2[≤]c1 ∧ c1[≤]c0)→ c2[≤]c0), c2 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  eluzel2(c1, c2)
  eluzelz(c1, c2)
  adantr(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), c1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c2), c0 ∈ ℤ)
  eluzelz(c0, c1)
  zletr(c2, c1, c0)
  eluz2(c0, c2)
}

blocks.name: uztrn2
blocks.content: Transitive law for sets of upper integers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Dec-2013.)

blocks.name: uzneg
blocks.content: Contraposition law for upper integers. (Contributed by NM, 28-Nov-2005.)
blocks.origin:
thm uzneg(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cneg(c1), cfv(cuz, cneg(c0))))
} = {
  mpbird(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cneg(c1), cfv(cuz, cneg(c0))), wbr(cneg(c0), cle, cneg(c1)))
  mpbid(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wbr(cneg(c0), cle, cneg(c1)), wbr(c1, cle, c0))
  eluzle(c0, c1)
  syl2anc(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wb(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(cneg(c0), cle, cneg(c1))), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz))
  syl2an(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz), wb(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(cneg(c0), cle, cneg(c1))), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c0, cr))
  zre(c1)
  zre(c0)
  leneg(c1, c0)
  syl2anc(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wb(wcel(cneg(c1), cfv(cuz, cneg(c0))), wbr(cneg(c0), cle, cneg(c1))), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz))
  eluzelz(c0, c1)
  eluzel2(c0, c1)
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wb(wcel(cneg(c1), cfv(cuz, cneg(c0))), wbr(cneg(c0), cle, cneg(c1))), wcel(cneg(c0), cz), wcel(cneg(c1), cz))
  znegcl(c0)
  znegcl(c1)
  eluz(cneg(c0), cneg(c1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm uzneg(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)→ -u(c1)∈(ℤ≥ ` -u(c0)))
} = {
  mpbird(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), -u(c1)∈(ℤ≥ ` -u(c0)), -u(c0)[≤]-u(c1))
  mpbid(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), -u(c0)[≤]-u(c1), c1[≤]c0)
  eluzle(c0, c1)
  syl2anc(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), (c1[≤]c0 ↔ -u(c0)[≤]-u(c1)), c1 ∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  syl2an(c1 ∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ ℤ, (c1[≤]c0 ↔ -u(c0)[≤]-u(c1)), c1 ∈ ℝ, c0 ∈ ℝ)
  zre(c1)
  zre(c0)
  leneg(c1, c0)
  syl2anc(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), (-u(c1)∈(ℤ≥ ` -u(c0))↔ -u(c0)[≤]-u(c1)), c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℤ)
  eluzelz(c0, c1)
  eluzel2(c0, c1)
  syl2an(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℤ, (-u(c1)∈(ℤ≥ ` -u(c0))↔ -u(c0)[≤]-u(c1)), -u(c0)∈ ℤ, -u(c1)∈ ℤ)
  znegcl(c0)
  znegcl(c1)
  eluz(-u(c0), -u(c1))
}

blocks.name: uzssz
blocks.content: An upper set of integers is a subset of all integers. (Contributed by NM, 2-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 3-Nov-2013.)

blocks.name: uzss
blocks.content: Subset relationship for two sets of upper integers. (Contributed by NM, 5-Sep-2005.)
blocks.origin:
thm uzss(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wss(cfv(cuz, c0), cfv(cuz, c1)))
} = {
  ssrdv(hs0, cfv(cuz, c0), cfv(cuz, c1), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)))
  3imtr4d(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0))))
  imdistanda(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0)))

blocks.pretty:
thm uzss(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)→(ℤ≥ ` c0)⊆(ℤ≥ ` c1))
} = {
  ssrdv(hs0, (ℤ≥ ` c0), (ℤ≥ ` c1), c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1))
  3imtr4d(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0), hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), (hs0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c0[≤]hs0), (hs0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1[≤]hs0))
  imdistanda(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), hs0 ∈ ℤ, c0[≤]hs0, c1[≤]hs0)
  mpand((c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)∧ hs0 ∈ ℤ), c0[≤]hs0, c1[≤]hs0, c1[≤]c0)
  adantr(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), hs0 ∈ ℤ, c1[≤]c0)
  eluzle(c0, c1)
  sylan(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), hs0 ∈ ℤ, ((c1[≤]c0 ∧ c0[≤]hs0)→ c1[≤]hs0), (c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ c0 ∈ ℤ))
  jca(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), c1 ∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  3expa(c1 ∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ ℤ, hs0 ∈ ℤ, ((c1[≤]c0 ∧ c0[≤]hs0)→ c1[≤]hs0))
  zletr(c1, c0, hs0)
  syl(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), (hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0)↔(hs0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c0[≤]hs0)), c0 ∈ ℤ)
  eluzelz(c0, c1)
  eluz1(c0, hs0)
  syl(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), (hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)↔(hs0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1[≤]hs0)), c1 ∈ ℤ)
  eluzel2(c0, c1)
  eluz1(c1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.c((ℤ≥ ` c0))
  diff.hs0.c((ℤ≥ ` c1))
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1))
}

  ad2antrl(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wbr(co(c0, caddc, nat1), cle, c1), wcel(co(c1, cmin, nat1), cz))

  eleq12d(co(c0, caddc, c2), cfv(cuz, co(cif(c1, nat0, wcel(c1, cz)), caddc, c2)), co(c0, caddc, cif(c2, nat0, wcel(c2, cz))), cfv(cuz, co(cif(c1, nat0, wcel(c1, cz)), caddc, cif(c2, nat0, wcel(c2, cz)))), wceq(c2, cif(c2, nat0, wcel(c2, cz))))

  oveq2(c2, cif(c2, nat0, wcel(c2, cz)), cif(c1, nat0, wcel(c1, cz)), caddc)

blocks.origin:
thm eluzsub(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, co(c0, caddc, c1)))), wcel(co(c2, cmin, c1), cfv(cuz, c0)))

  zsubcl(c0, c1)
  sylan2(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c2), (c0[-]c2)∈ ℤ, c2 ∈ ℤ)

  imbi2i(wcel(c0, cz), wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cz), wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0))), w0), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cz), wi(wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)), w0)))
  impexp(wcel(cv(s0), cz), wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)), w0)
  bi2.04(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cv(s0), cz), wi(wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)), w0))
  r19.21v(s0, cz, wcel(c0, cz), wi(wbr(c0, cle, cv(s0)), w0))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cz)
  diff.cz.s(s0)
}

  oveq2(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, nat1), c0, caddc)

blocks.name: nn0pzuz
blocks.content: The sum of a nonnegative integer and an integer is an integer greater than or equal to that integer. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 3-Oct-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm nn0pzuz(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c1), cfv(cuz, c1)))
} = {
  syl3anbrc(wa(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c1), cfv(cuz, c1)), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c1), cz), wbr(c1, cle, co(c0, caddc, c1)))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cz))
  sylan(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c1), cz), wcel(c0, cz))
  nn0z(c0)
  zaddcl(c0, c1)
  ancoms(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cz), wbr(c1, cle, co(c0, caddc, c1)))
  sylan(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cn0), wbr(c1, cle, co(c0, caddc, c1)), wcel(c1, cr))
  zre(c1)
  nn0addge2(c1, c0)
  eluz2(co(c0, caddc, c1), c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm nn0pzuz(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℕ0 ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)→(c0[+]c1)∈(ℤ≥ ` c1))
} = {
  syl3anbrc((c0 ∈ ℕ0 ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), (c0[+]c1)∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), c1 ∈ ℤ, (c0[+]c1)∈ ℤ, c1[≤](c0[+]c1))
  simpr(c0 ∈ ℕ0, c1 ∈ ℤ)
  sylan(c0 ∈ ℕ0, c1 ∈ ℤ, (c0[+]c1)∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  nn0z(c0)
  zaddcl(c0, c1)
  ancoms(c0 ∈ ℕ0, c1 ∈ ℤ, c1[≤](c0[+]c1))
  sylan(c1 ∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ ℕ0, c1[≤](c0[+]c1), c1 ∈ ℝ)
  zre(c1)
  nn0addge2(c1, c0)
  eluz2((c0[+]c1), c1)
}

blocks.name: uzind4
blocks.content: Induction on the upper set of integers that starts at an integer ` M ` . The first four hypotheses give us the substitution instances we need, and the last two are the basis and the induction step. (Contributed by NM, 7-Sep-2005.)
blocks.origin:
thm uzind4(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), w0)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c1), wb(w1, w2))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w1, w3))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), caddc, nat1)), wb(w1, w4))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0))
  -| wi(wcel(c1, cz), w2)
  -| wi(wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cuz, c1)), wi(w3, w4))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w4)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
} = {
  syl2anc(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), w0, wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, crab(hs0, cz, wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0)))))
  eluzel2(c0, c1)
  elrabd(hs0, c0, cz, wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(c1, cle, c0))
  breq2(cv(hs0), c0, c1, cle)
  eluzelz(c0, c1)
  eluzle(c0, c1)
  uzind3(hs0, s0, s1, c1, c0, w0, w1, w2, w3, w4)
  syl(wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(cv(s1), crab(hs0, cz, wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0))))), wi(w3, w4), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cuz, c1)))
  sylan2b(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(cv(s1), crab(hs0, cz, wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0)))), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cuz, c1)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), cz), wbr(c1, cle, cv(s1))))
  elrab(hs0, cv(s1), cz, wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(c1, cle, cv(s1)))
  breq2(cv(hs0), cv(s1), c1, cle)
  3expb(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(cv(s1), cz), wbr(c1, cle, cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cuz, c1)))
  biimpri(w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(cv(s1), cz), wbr(c1, cle, cv(s1))), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cuz, c1)))
  eluz2(cv(s1), c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(c1, cle, c0))
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s1))
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(c1, cle, cv(s1)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm uzind4(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)→ w0)
  ⊣ (s0 = c1 →(w1 ↔ w2))
  ⊣ (s0 = s1 →(w1 ↔ w3))
  ⊣ (s0 =(s1[+]1)→(w1 ↔ w4))
  ⊣ (s0 = c0 →(w1 ↔ w0))
  ⊣ (c1 ∈ ℤ → w2)
  ⊣ (s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)→(w3 → w4))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w2)
  ⊣ d(s0, w3)
  ⊣ d(s0, w4)
  ⊣ d(s1, w1)
} = {
  syl2anc(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), w0, c1 ∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ { hs0 ∈ ℤ | c1[≤]hs0 })
  eluzel2(c0, c1)
  elrabd(hs0, c0, cz, c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), c1[≤]hs0, c1[≤]c0)
  breq2(hs0, c0, c1, cle)
  eluzelz(c0, c1)
  eluzle(c0, c1)
  uzind3(hs0, s0, s1, c1, c0, w0, w1, w2, w3, w4)
  syl((c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ s1 ∈ { hs0 ∈ ℤ | c1[≤]hs0 }), (w3 → w4), s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1))
  sylan2b(c1 ∈ ℤ, s1 ∈ { hs0 ∈ ℤ | c1[≤]hs0 }, s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), (s1 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1[≤]s1))
  elrab(hs0, s1, cz, c1[≤]hs0, c1[≤]s1)
  breq2(hs0, s1, c1, cle)
  3expb(c1 ∈ ℤ, s1 ∈ ℤ, c1[≤]s1, s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1))
  biimpri((c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ s1 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1[≤]s1), s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1))
  eluz2(s1, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.w(c1[≤]c0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(c1[≤]s1)
}

blocks.name: uzind4ALT
blocks.content: Induction on the upper set of integers that starts at an integer ` M ` . The last four hypotheses give us the substitution instances we need; the first two are the basis and the induction step. Either ~ uzind4 or ~ uzind4ALT may be used; see comment for ~ nnind . (Contributed by NM, 7-Sep-2005.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm uzind4ALT(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), w0)
  -| wi(wcel(c1, cz), w1)
  -| wi(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, c1)), wi(w2, w3))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s1), c1), wb(w4, w1))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wb(w4, w2))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), wb(w4, w3))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s1), c0), wb(w4, w0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w4)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
  -| diffsw(s1, w2)
  -| diffsw(s1, w3)
} = {
  uzind4(s1, s0, c0, c1, w0, w4, w1, w2, w3)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm uzind4ALT(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)→ w0)
  ⊣ (c1 ∈ ℤ → w1)
  ⊣ (s0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)→(w2 → w3))
  ⊣ (s1 = c1 →(w4 ↔ w1))
  ⊣ (s1 = s0 →(w4 ↔ w2))
  ⊣ (s1 =(s0[+]1)→(w4 ↔ w3))
  ⊣ (s1 = c0 →(w4 ↔ w0))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, w4)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
  ⊣ d(s1, w1)
  ⊣ d(s1, w2)
  ⊣ d(s1, w3)
} = {
  uzind4(s1, s0, c0, c1, w0, w4, w1, w2, w3)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)

thm uzind4s(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)→[c0 / s0]w0)
  ⊣ (c1 ∈ ℤ →[c1 / s0]w0)
  ⊣ (s0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)→(w0 →[(s0[+]1)/ s0]w0))
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  uzind4(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, [c0 / s0]w0, [hs0 / s0]w0, [c1 / s0]w0, [hs1 / s0]w0, [(hs1[+]1)/ s0]w0)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c1, w0)
  sbequ(hs0, hs1, s0, w0)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, (hs1[+]1), w0)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w0)
  chvar(s0, hs1, (hs1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)→([hs1 / s0]w0 →[(hs1[+]1)/ s0]w0)), (s0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)→(w0 →[(s0[+]1)/ s0]w0)))
  nfim(s0, hs1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), ([hs1 / s0]w0 →[(hs1[+]1)/ s0]w0))
  nfv(s0, hs1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1))
  nfim(s0, [hs1 / s0]w0, [(hs1[+]1)/ s0]w0)
  nfs1v(s0, hs1, w0)
  nfsbc1v(s0, (hs1[+]1), w0)
  imbi12d(s0 = hs1, s0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), (w0 →[(s0[+]1)/ s0]w0), hs1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), ([hs1 / s0]w0 →[(hs1[+]1)/ s0]w0))
  eleq1w(s0, hs1, (ℤ≥ ` c1))
  imbi12d(s0 = hs1, w0, [(s0[+]1)/ s0]w0, [hs1 / s0]w0, [(hs1[+]1)/ s0]w0)
  sbequ12(s0, hs1, w0)
  sbceq1d(s0, (s0[+]1), (hs1[+]1), s0 = hs1, w0)
  oveq1(s0, hs1, caddc, nat1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)

  diff.nat1.s(s0)
}

  dfsbcq(s0, cv(s1), cv(hs1), w0)

blocks.name: uzind4i
blocks.content: Induction on the upper integers that start at ` M ` . The first four give us the substitution instances we need, and the last two are the basis and the induction step. This is a stronger version of ~ uzind4 assuming that ` ps ` holds unconditionally. Notice that ` N e. ( ZZ>= `` M ) ` implies that the lower bound ` M ` is an integer ( ` M e. ZZ ` , see ~ eluzel2 ). (Contributed by NM, 4-Sep-2005.) (Revised by AV, 13-Jul-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm uzind4i(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), w0)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c1), wb(w1, w2))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w1, w3))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), caddc, nat1)), wb(w1, w4))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0))
  -| w2
  -| wi(wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cuz, c1)), wi(w3, w4))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w4)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
} = {
  uzind4(s0, s1, c0, c1, w0, w1, w2, w3, w4)
  a1i(wcel(c1, cz), w2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm uzind4i(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)→ w0)
  ⊣ (s0 = c1 →(w1 ↔ w2))
  ⊣ (s0 = s1 →(w1 ↔ w3))
  ⊣ (s0 =(s1[+]1)→(w1 ↔ w4))
  ⊣ (s0 = c0 →(w1 ↔ w0))
  ⊣ w2
  ⊣ (s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1)→(w3 → w4))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w2)
  ⊣ d(s0, w3)
  ⊣ d(s0, w4)
  ⊣ d(s1, w1)
} = {
  uzind4(s0, s1, c0, c1, w0, w1, w2, w3, w4)
  a1i(c1 ∈ ℤ, w2)
}

  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs2), c1), wa(wss(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wn(wrex(s0, c0, wral(hs0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(hs0)))))), wral(hs0, c0, wbr(cv(hs2), cle, cv(hs0))), wral(hs0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cv(hs0))))

blocks.name: uzwo2
blocks.content: Well-ordering principle: any nonempty subset of an upper set of integers has a unique least element. (Contributed by NM, 8-Oct-2005.)
blocks.origin:
thm uzwo2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wss(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wne(c0, emptycls)), wreu(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl2an2r(wss(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wne(c0, emptycls), wreu(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))), wss(c0, cr), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))))
  mpan2(wss(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)), wss(c0, cr), wss(cfv(cuz, c1), cr))
  sstri(cfv(cuz, c1), cr, cz)
  uzssz(c1)
  zssre()
  sstr(c0, cfv(cuz, c1), cr)
  uzwo(s0, s1, c0, c1)
  lbreu(s0, s1, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm uzwo2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ⊆(ℤ≥ ` c1)∧ c0 ≠ ∅)→ ∃!(s0 ∈ c0, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1)))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl2an2r(c0 ⊆(ℤ≥ ` c1), c0 ≠ ∅, ∃!(s0 ∈ c0, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1)), c0 ⊆ ℝ, ∃(s0 ∈ c0, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1)))
  mpan2(c0 ⊆(ℤ≥ ` c1), c0 ⊆ ℝ, (ℤ≥ ` c1)⊆ ℝ)
  sstri((ℤ≥ ` c1), cr, cz)
  uzssz(c1)
  zssre()
  sstr(c0, (ℤ≥ ` c1), cr)
  uzwo(s0, s1, c0, c1)
  lbreu(s0, s1, c0)
}

blocks.name: nnwo
blocks.content: Well-ordering principle: any nonempty set of positive integers has a least element. Theorem I.37 (well-ordering principle) of [Apostol] p. 34. (Contributed by NM, 17-Aug-2001.)

blocks.name: nnwof
blocks.content: Well-ordering principle: any nonempty set of positive integers has a least element. This version allows ` x ` and ` y ` to be present in ` A ` as long as they are effectively not free. (Contributed by NM, 17-Aug-2001.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2016.)

thm nnwof(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wss(c0, cn), wne(c0, emptycls)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))))

  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  sylib(wa(wss(c0, cn), wne(c0, emptycls)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))), wrex(hs0, c0, wral(hs1, c0, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(hs1)))))
  nnwo(hs0, hs1, c0)
  cbvrexf(hs0, s0, c0, wral(hs1, c0, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(hs1))), wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))

  ralbidv(hs1, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(hs1)))
  breq1(cv(hs0), cv(s0), cle, cv(hs1))

}
blocks.pretty:
thm nnwof(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ⊆ ℕ ∧ c0 ≠ ∅)→ ∃(s0 ∈ c0, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1)))
  ⊣ F/(s0, c0)
  ⊣ F/(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
} = {
  sylib((c0 ⊆ ℕ ∧ c0 ≠ ∅), ∃(s0 ∈ c0, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1)), ∃(hs0 ∈ c0, ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, hs0[≤]hs1)))
  nnwo(hs0, hs1, c0)
  cbvrexf(hs0, s0, c0, ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, hs0[≤]hs1), ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1))
  nfcv(hs0, c0)
  nfral(s0, hs1, c0, hs0[≤]hs1)
  nfv(s0, hs0[≤]hs1)
  nfv(hs0, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1))
  syl6bb(hs0 = s0, ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, hs0[≤]hs1), ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1), ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]hs1))
  ralbidv(hs1, c0, hs0 = s0, hs0[≤]hs1, s0[≤]hs1)
  breq1(hs0, s0, cle, hs1)
  cbvralf(hs1, s1, c0, s0[≤]hs1, s0[≤]s1)
  nfcv(hs1, c0)
  nfv(s1, s0[≤]hs1)
  nfv(hs1, s0[≤]s1)
  breq2(hs1, s1, s0, cle)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, hs0, cle, hs1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cle.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1))
  diff.hs1.w(hs0 = s0)

  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)

  diffss.ex(s1, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.hs1.w(s0[≤]s1)
}

thm nnwos(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wrex(s0, cn, w0), wrex(s0, cn, wa(w0, wral(s1, cn, wi(w1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))))))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w1)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  3imtr3i(wrex(s0, cn, w0), wrex(s0, cn, wa(w0, wral(s1, cn, wi(w1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))))), wa(wss(crab(s0, cn, w0), cn), wne(crab(s0, cn, w0), emptycls)), wrex(s0, crab(s0, cn, w0), wral(s1, crab(s0, cn, w0), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))))
  nnwof(s0, s1, crab(s0, cn, w0))
  nfrab1(s0, cn, w0)
  nfcv(s1, crab(s0, cn, w0))
  bitr3i(wa(wss(crab(s0, cn, w0), cn), wne(crab(s0, cn, w0), emptycls)), wrex(s0, cn, w0), wne(crab(s0, cn, w0), emptycls))
  biantrur(wne(crab(s0, cn, w0), emptycls), wss(crab(s0, cn, w0), cn))
  ssrab2(s0, cn, w0)
  rabn0(s0, cn, w0)
  3bitri(wrex(s0, crab(s0, cn, w0), wral(s1, crab(s0, cn, w0), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))), wrex(s0, cn, wa(w0, wral(s1, cn, wi(w1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))))), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), crab(s0, cn, w0)), wral(s1, crab(s0, cn, w0), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))), wex(s0, wa(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), w0), wal(s1, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cn), wi(w1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))))))

  anbi12i(wcel(cv(s0), crab(s0, cn, w0)), wral(s1, crab(s0, cn, w0), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), w0), wal(s1, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cn), wi(w1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))))
  rabid(s0, cn, w0)
  bitri(wral(s1, crab(s0, cn, w0), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))), wal(s1, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cn), wi(w1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))), wal(s1, wi(wcel(cv(s1), crab(s0, cn, w0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))))
  df-ral(s1, crab(s0, cn, w0), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))
  albii(s1, wi(wcel(cv(s1), crab(s0, cn, w0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))), wi(wcel(cv(s1), cn), wi(w1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))))

  imbi1i(wcel(cv(s1), crab(s0, cn, w0)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), cn), w1))

blocks.name: indstr
blocks.content: Strong Mathematical Induction for positive integers (inference schema). (Contributed by NM, 17-Aug-2001.)
blocks.origin:
thm indstr(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wcel(cv(s0), cn), w0)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w1))
  -| wi(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wi(wral(s1, cn, wi(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), w1)), w0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w1)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  rspec(s0, cn, w0)
  mpbir(wral(s0, cn, w0), wn(wrex(s0, cn, wn(w0))))
  mto(wrex(s0, cn, wn(w0)), wrex(s0, cn, wa(wn(w0), wral(s1, cn, wi(wn(w1), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))))))
  nrex(s0, cn, wa(wn(w0), wral(s1, cn, wi(wn(w1), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))))
  mtoi(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wa(wn(w0), wral(s1, cn, wi(wn(w1), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))), wa(w0, wn(w0)))
  pm3.24(w0)
  syl6ib(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wa(wn(w0), wral(s1, cn, wi(wn(w1), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))), wa(w0, wn(w0)), wa(wn(w0), w0))
  anim2d(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wn(w0), wral(s1, cn, wi(wn(w1), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))), w0)
  sylbid(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wral(s1, cn, wi(wn(w1), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))), w0, wral(s1, cn, wi(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), w1)))
  ralbidva(s1, cn, wcel(cv(s0), cn), wi(wn(w1), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))), wi(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), w1))
  syl6bbr(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(s1), cn)), wi(wn(w1), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))), wi(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), w1), wi(wn(w1), wn(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)))))
  imbi2d(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(s1), cn)), wn(w1), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)), wn(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0))))
  syl2an(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(s1), cn), wb(wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)), wn(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)))), wcel(cv(s0), cr), wcel(cv(s1), cr))
  nnre(cv(s0))
  nnre(cv(s1))
  lenlt(cv(s0), cv(s1))
  con34b(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), w1)
  ancom(wn(w0), w0)
  nnwos(s0, s1, wn(w0), wn(w1))
  notbid(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0, w1)
  dfral2(s0, cn, w0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(s0), cn)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cn.s(s1)
  diff.wn.s(s0, w1)
  diff.wn.s(s1, w0)
}

blocks.name: elnn1uz2

blocks.origin:
thm elnn1uz2(class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cn), wo(wceq(c0, nat1), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2))))

  3bitrri(wcel(c0, cn), wo(wceq(c0, nat1), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2))), wo(wceq(c0, nat1), wa(wcel(c0, cn), wne(c0, nat1))), wo(wceq(c0, nat1), wcel(c0, cn)))
  orbi2i(wceq(c0, nat1), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wa(wcel(c0, cn), wne(c0, nat1)))
  eluz2b3(c0)
  mpbiran2(wo(wceq(c0, nat1), wa(wcel(c0, cn), wne(c0, nat1))), wo(wceq(c0, nat1), wcel(c0, cn)), wo(wceq(c0, nat1), wne(c0, nat1)))
  exmidne(c0, nat1)
  ordi(wceq(c0, nat1), wcel(c0, cn), wne(c0, nat1))
  impbii(wo(wceq(c0, nat1), wcel(c0, cn)), wcel(c0, cn))
  ax-mp(wi(wo(wceq(c0, nat1), wcel(c0, cn)), wcel(c0, cn)), wi(wceq(c0, nat1), wcel(c0, cn)))
  mpbiri(wceq(c0, nat1), wcel(c0, cn), wcel(nat1, cn))

blocks.name: uz2mulcl
blocks.content: Closure of multiplication of integers greater than or equal to 2. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 26-Oct-2012.)

thm uz2mulcl(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, nat2))), wcel(co(c0, cmul, c1), cfv(cuz, nat2)))

  sylanbrc(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, nat2))), wcel(co(c0, cmul, c1), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(co(c0, cmul, c1), cz), wbr(nat1, clt, co(c0, cmul, c1)))

  eluzelz(c1, nat2)

  syl2an(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wbr(nat1, clt, co(c0, cmul, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat1, clt, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cr), wbr(nat1, clt, c1)))
  sylbi(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat1, clt, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(nat1, clt, c0)))
  eluz2b1(c0)

blocks.name: indstr2
blocks.content: Strong Mathematical Induction for positive integers (inference schema). The first two hypotheses give us the substitution instances we need; the last two are the basis and the induction step. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Nov-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm indstr2(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(wcel(cv(s0), cn), w0)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), nat1), wb(w0, w1))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w2))
  -| w1
  -| wi(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wi(wral(s1, cn, wi(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), w2)), w0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  indstr(s0, s1, w0, w2)
  sylbi(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wi(wral(s1, cn, wi(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), w2)), w0), wo(wceq(cv(s0), nat1), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, nat2))))
  elnn1uz2(cv(s0))
  jaoi(wceq(cv(s0), nat1), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wi(wral(s1, cn, wi(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), w2)), w0))
  mpbiri(wceq(cv(s0), nat1), wi(wral(s1, cn, wi(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), w2)), w0), w1)
  bitrd(wceq(cv(s0), nat1), wi(wral(s1, cn, wi(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), w2)), w0), w1, w0)
  syl(wceq(cv(s0), nat1), wb(wi(wral(s1, cn, wi(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), w2)), w0), w0), wral(s1, cn, wi(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), w2)))
  ralrimiva(s1, cn, wceq(cv(s0), nat1), wi(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), w2))
  pm2.21d(wa(wceq(cv(s0), nat1), wcel(cv(s1), cn)), wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), w2)
  mtbird(wa(wceq(cv(s0), nat1), wcel(cv(s1), cn)), wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s1), clt, nat1))
  adantl(wceq(cv(s0), nat1), wcel(cv(s1), cn), wn(wbr(cv(s1), clt, nat1)))
  nnnlt1(cv(s1))
  adantr(wceq(cv(s0), nat1), wcel(cv(s1), cn), wb(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s1), clt, nat1)))
  breq2(cv(s0), nat1, cv(s1), clt)
  pm5.5(wral(s1, cn, wi(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)), w2)), w0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(s0), nat1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.nat1.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: uzinfi
blocks.content: Extract the lower bound of an upper set of integers as its infimum. (Contributed by NM, 7-Oct-2005.) (Revised by AV, 4-Sep-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm uzinfi(class c0) {
  |- wceq(cinf(cfv(cuz, c0), cr, clt), c0)
  -| wcel(c0, cz)
} = {
  ax-mp(wceq(cinf(cfv(cuz, c0), cr, clt), c0), wcel(c0, cz))
  infmin(hs0, cfv(cuz, c0), cr, clt, c0, wcel(c0, cz))
  a1i(wcel(c0, cz), wor(clt, cr))
  ltso()
  uzid(c0)
  impcom(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c0)), wn(wbr(cv(hs0), clt, c0)))
  sylbi(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, c0)), wi(wcel(c0, cz), wn(wbr(cv(hs0), clt, c0))), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0))))
  eluz2(cv(hs0), c0)
  a1d(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0))), wcel(c0, cz), wn(wbr(cv(hs0), clt, c0)))
  biimp3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wbr(c0, cle, cv(hs0)), wn(wbr(cv(hs0), clt, c0)))
  lenltd(c0, cv(hs0), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cv(hs0), cz)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wcel(c0, cr))
  zre(c0)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wcel(cv(hs0), cr))
  zre(cv(hs0))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cuz, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.hs0.c(clt)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, cz))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm uzinfi(class c0) {
  ⊢ inf((ℤ≥ ` c0), ℝ, <)= c0
  ⊣ c0 ∈ ℤ
} = {
  ax-mp(inf((ℤ≥ ` c0), ℝ, <)= c0, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  infmin(hs0, (ℤ≥ ` c0), cr, clt, c0, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  a1i(c0 ∈ ℤ, < ≺ ℝ)
  ltso()
  uzid(c0)
  impcom(c0 ∈ ℤ, hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0), ¬ hs0[<]c0)
  sylbi(hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c0), (c0 ∈ ℤ → ¬ hs0[<]c0), (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ hs0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c0[≤]hs0))
  eluz2(hs0, c0)
  a1d((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ hs0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c0[≤]hs0), c0 ∈ ℤ, ¬ hs0[<]c0)

blocks.name: supminf
blocks.content: The supremum of a bounded-above set of reals is the negation of the infimum of that set's image under negation. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Mar-2011.) ( Revised by AV, 13-Sep-2020.)

blocks.name: nn0ge2m1nnALT
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ nn0ge2m1nn : If a nonnegative integer is greater than or equal to two, the integer decreased by 1 is a positive integer. This version is proved using ~ eluz2 , a theorem for upper sets of integers, which are defined later than the positive and nonnegative integers. This proof is, however, much shorter than the proof of ~ nn0ge2m1nn . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 1-Aug-2018.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
